Articles.Content:
Oh, Zekes? Something I just thought of.

What happens when they take out the nuclear drive?

I have a problem. Fortunately, I have two, and it's hard to completely take out, and even then I have good missile range. Plus, there's no exhaust, so I can armor it (which I have done on all my ships).

I'd say it's still harder to kill that than a jet engine.

I have a problem. Fortunately, I have two, and it's hard to completely take out, and even then I have good missile range. Plus, there's no exhaust, so I can armor it (which I have done on all my ships).

I'd say it's still harder to kill that than a jet engine.

What graphics card do you use zekes???

What graphics card do you use zekes???

NVIDIA GEFORCE GTX 560M

of course, what you define as "runnable" depends on your tolerance level XD

So you can run 1800 parts on that??? EDIT: I have overclocked my 650 ti to 1161 mhz! Now I just need to increase fan speed...

Edited January 22, 2015 by ejudedude13

So you can run 1800 parts on that???

like i said, it's my limit.

Although i did put my 1500 part battleship next to Spartwo's 1500 part battleship. ONCE.
Nevermid, my directx crashed when I tried to run bf3 at 1161mhz. Overoverclocked.... Brought it back to 1131mhz. Time to overclock memory.

Nevermid, my directx crashed when I tried to run bf3 at 1161mhz. Overoverclocked.... Brought it back to 1131mhz. Time to overclock memory.

I can't overclock mine - thanks, laptop-makers
DAMMIT Crahed again..... Upping voltage, lowering clock speed. Thank god for MSI afterburner.

PC desktop master race. I overclocked both my gpu and memory by 200 mhz (with headroom) on my GTX 760 SC. Stock voltage and fan curve.

My laptop on the other hand has intel iris graphics. I don't think it's possible to overclock integrated graphics.

Upping voltage is a recipe for popped capacitors. Not to mention a fried VRM.

Edited January 22, 2015 by andrew123

PC desktop master race. I overclocked both my gpu and memory by 200 mhz (with headroom) on my GTX 760 SC. Stock voltage and fan curve.

My laptop on the other hand has intel iris graphics. I don't think it's possible to overclock integrated graphics.

Upping voltage is a recipe for popped capacitors. Not to mention a fried VRM.

Afterburner has a safe limit though, so its amost immpossible to over do it. Of course, increasing voltage can hurt in the long term...

Edited January 22, 2015 by ejudedude13

I do not recall you proposing one yourself, but I, too, am up for a battle; for the first time, I have a fleet that I am relatively pleased with, so I am eager to take it into combat (this will be my first true battle, actually). As to the specifications, I would go for 350 tons and 3 ships; you can choose the location if you wish, and also whether or not to try out the ten-tons-or-two-missiles rule.

My ships would be my new battlecruiser, the new Vertex, and the Lepton class fighter (I just need to upgrade its weapons technology); I shall post screenshots once I am finished upgrading their armaments.

I was thinking Moho is fairly straight forward, I'll set up after work.

The most parts my computers ever taken was around 800 but it could probably take 1200.

I'm up for a battle now that I have a good fleet.

like i said, it's my limit.

Although i did put my 1500 part battleship next to Spartwo's 1500 part battleship. ONCE.

*800 part.
Just saying, Directx is still crashing. Overclocking is mostly a trial and error thing I guess

Does anybody want to battle me. I was thinking two frigates and a destroyer/cruiser, 300t.

@ Three: https://www./?8df1fcc3adi2h32

Excellent! I shall set up immediately.

BATTLE ALERT!

Mr Tegu vs. Three1415 over Moho

3 ships and 350 tons

___________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

I deployed three distinct vessels, as shown below:

The C3V ("cee-three-vee") Fermi, a Lepton Class Fighter MK IV, at 18.03 tons and 341 parts;

The C3V Euclid, a Vertex Class Destroyer, at 80.29 tons and 876 parts;

and finally the C3V Zwicky, a Dark Matter Class Battlecruiser, at 251.16 tons and 1144 parts.

I went ahead and took my turn, as I have by far the lightest ship present.

Turn One Summary: I intercepted the nearest Murderer with my fighter and unloaded the entirety of its armament. Unsurprisingly given the mass discrepancy between the two vessels, the Fermi was able to inflict only moderate damage, destroying approximately half the Murderer's fuel, two of its heavy missiles, and multiple assorted support components (such as SAS modules), before retreating into a low polar orbit. The target is still functional, however, even if its range is somewhat reduced.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

I've built my first bomber(or military aircraft for that matter). Say hello to the B-55.

It's great for carpet bombing.

And can even climb vertically.

Here's the file.

On another note, I did some tank testing recently.

As you can see I destroyed the entire KSC with one tank before destroying it too.
